SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.service

Class PlannerService

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.service.PlannerService
public class PlannerService extends Object
Service for the PlannerView. This class is a singleton and is used to manage the planner's data.

Fields: service, planner

Add task methods: addTask(SingleTask), isTimeExist(LocalTime), findIndexForNewRow(LocalTime), prepareNewRow(SingleTask)

Delete task methods: deleteTask(SingleTask), removeRow(DefaultTableModel, int), getCorrectValuesFromRow(LocalTime)

Other methods: editTask(SingleTask, SingleTask), findRowIndex(LocalTime), findColumnIndex(WeekDays), isTaskInPlanner(SingleTask), getSelectedValue(), getSelectedTime(), getSelectedWeekday()

Helper methods: prepareValue(SingleTask), actualizeSummarizeForWeekday(WeekDays)

      public PlannerService()

  • Method Details

    • addTask

      public boolean addTask(SingleTask task)
      Add a given task to the planner. It checks if a time of the task is already in the planner. If it is, it updates the cell in the row, otherwise it adds a new row with the given task. Then it actualizes the summarize for the task's weekday. It returns false if the given task is null or is already in the planner.
      Parameters:
      task - a given task which should be added to the planner
      Returns:
      true if the task is successfully added, otherwise false.
      See Also:
      • isTimeExist(LocalTime)
      • actualizeSummarizeForWeekday(WeekDays)
      • isTaskInPlanner(SingleTask)
      • TaskAddingDialogController.addTask(SingleTask)
      • editTask(SingleTask, SingleTask)

    • deleteTask

      public boolean deleteTask(SingleTask task)
      Deletes the task from the planner. If the row has only one task and there are more than two rows in the planner, the row is removed. When the row has more than one task, the cell with the given task is filled with a "-" symbol. At the end, the summarize for the task's weekday is actualized. Returns false if the given task is null or is not in the planner.
      Parameters:
      task - a given task which should be removed from the planner
      Returns:
      true is the task is successfully deleted, otherwise false
      See Also:
      • MainPanelController.deleteTask()
      • MainPanelController.deleteTasksForWeekdays(List)
      • TaskAddingDialogController.addTask(SingleTask)
      • editTask(SingleTask, SingleTask)
      • isTaskInPlanner(SingleTask)
      • findRowIndex(LocalTime)
      • findColumnIndex(WeekDays)
      • getCorrectValuesFromRow(LocalTime)
      • removeRow(DefaultTableModel, int)
      • actualizeSummarizeForWeekday(WeekDays)

    • editTask

      public boolean editTask(SingleTask oldTask, SingleTask editedTask)
      Edits an old task in the planner. If old task or edited task is null or they are equals, it returns false. Then, it deletes the old task and adds the edited one. If adding new task fails, it runs rollback and returns a result.
      Parameters:
      oldTask - a task which should be deleted
      editedTask - a new task which should be added
      Returns:
      true if the task is successfully edited, otherwise false
      See Also:
      • isTaskInPlanner(SingleTask)
      • deleteTask(SingleTask)
      • addTask(SingleTask)
      • DialogUtils.rollback(SingleTask, Consumer, Function)
      • MainPanelController.resetPoints(List)
      • TaskEditingDialogController.editTask(SingleTask, SingleTask)

    • findRowIndex

      public int findRowIndex(LocalTime time)
      Parameters:
      time - a given time for which the row index should be found
      Returns:
      an index of the row which contains the given time
      See Also:
      • addTask(SingleTask)
      • deleteTask(SingleTask)
      • getCorrectValuesFromRow(LocalTime)

    • findColumnIndex

      public int findColumnIndex(WeekDays weekday)
      Parameters:
      weekday - a given weekday for which the column index should be found
      Returns:
      a column index which contains the given weekday
      See Also:
      • addTask(SingleTask)
      • deleteTask(SingleTask)
      • actualizeSummarizeForWeekday(WeekDays)

    • isTaskInPlanner

      public boolean isTaskInPlanner(SingleTask task)
      Try to find the given task in the planner.
      Parameters:
      task - a given task which should be found.
      Returns:
      true if the task is in the planner, otherwise false.

    • getSelectedValue

      public String getSelectedValue()
      Try to find the value of the selected cell in the planner. It creates Point based on the selected row and column. Then, it checks if the point is valid and returns the value of the selected cell.
      Returns:
      a String with the value of the selected cell in the planner or null
      See Also:
      • MainPanelController.deleteTask()

    • getSelectedTime

      public LocalTime getSelectedTime()
      Try to find the selected time in the planner. It checks if the selected row is not the first or last row. If it is, it returns null. Otherwise, it gets a value from the selected row in the first column, parse it to LocalTime and returns.
      Returns:
      a LocalTime with the selected time in the planner or null
      See Also:
      • MainPanelController.deleteTask()
      • PlannerController.editTask()

    • getSelectedWeekday

      public WeekDays getSelectedWeekday()
      Try to find the selected weekday in the planner. It gets a value from the first row in the selected column and converts it into WeekDays.
      Returns:
      a WeekDays with the selected weekday in the planner
      See Also:
      • MainPanelController.deleteTask()
      • PlannerController.editTask()
      • PlannerController.openFullWeekdaySchedule()
